description: Explore the invisible world of microbes and how we use them.

slides.title: The Invisible World
slides.content:
# Small but Mighty üî¨

Microbiology is the study of microscopic organisms:
- Bacteria
- Viruses
- Fungi
- Protozoa

They are everywhere: In air, soil, water, and YOU.

slides.title: Bacteria
slides.content:
# Prokaryotes ü¶†

- Single-celled, no nucleus.
- Shapes: Cocci (Spheres), Bacilli (Rods), Spirilla (Spirals).
- Divide by **Binary Fission** (Cloning).
- Most are helpful (Gut bacteria), some are harmful (Pathogens).

slides.title: Viruses
slides.content:
# The Hijackers üëΩ

- Not strictly "alive" (Can't reproduce on their own).
- Genetic material (DNA/RNA) in a protein coat.
- Must hijack a host cell to copy themselves.
- Examples: Flu, HIV, COVID-19.

slides.title: Fungi
slides.content:
# The Decomposers üçÑ

- Eukaryotes (Have nucleus).
- Yeasts (Single cell) and Molds (Multicellular).
- Absorb nutrients from environment.
- Penicillin comes from a mold!

slides.title: Protists
slides.content:
# The Misfits ü™±

- Eukaryotes that aren't Plant/Animal/Fungus.
- **Algae**: Plant-like (Photosynthesis).
- **Protozoa**: Animal-like (Amoeba, Paramecium).
- **Malaria** is caused by a protist.

slides.title: Microbe Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which microbe requires a host cell to reproduce?

slides.title: Microbiome
slides.content:
# You are a Planet üåç

You have more bacterial cells in/on you than human cells!
- Aid digestion.
- Produce vitamins (K).
- Train immune system.
- Protect against bad bugs.

slides.title: Germ Theory
slides.content:
# Louis Pasteur ü•õ

Proved that diseases are caused by microorganisms, not "bad air" (Miasma).
- **Pasteurization**: Heating to kill microbes.
- Led to sterilization and hygiene revolution.

slides.title: Antibiotics
slides.content:
# Magic Bullet üíä

Chemicals that kill Bacteria (NOT viruses).
- Attack cell walls or ribosomes specific to bacteria.
- **Fleming** discovered Penicillin.
- Overuse leads to resistance.

slides.title: Vaccines
slides.content:
# Training Day üèãÔ∏è

Exposing immune system to a harmless version of a pathogen.
- Body builds memory cells.
- Real infection is defeated instantly later.
- Eradicated Smallpox.

slides.title: Fermentation
slides.content:
# Tasty Microbes üçû

Using microbes to make food.
- **Yeast**: Alcohol (Beer/Wine) + CO2 (Bread rise).
- **Bacteria**: Lactic Acid (Yogurt, Cheese, Sauerkraut).

slides.title: Bioremediation
slides.content:
# Cleanup Crew üßπ

Using microbes to clean up pollution.
- Bacteria eating oil spills.
- Microbes breaking down plastic.
- Treating sewage water.

slides.title: Genetic Engineering
slides.content:
# GMOs üß¨

Taking a gene from one organism and putting it in another.
- **Insulin**: produced by E. coli bacteria with human insulin gene.
- **Bt Corn**: Corn with bacteria gene toxic to pests.

slides.title: Cloning
slides.content:
# Copy Paste üêë

- **Reproductive Cloning**: Making a whole copy (Dolly).
- **Therapeutic Cloning**: Making tissues/organs.
- High failure rate and ethical issues.

slides.title: Stem Cells
slides.content:
# Blank Slates ‚¨ú

Cells that can turn into any tissue.
- **Embryonic**: Pluripotent (Any cell).
- **Adult**: Multipotent (Limited types).
- Hope for curing paralysis, Parkinson's.

slides.title: Forensic DNA
slides.content:
# Catching Criminals üïµÔ∏è

- **DNA Fingerprinting**: Unique pattern for every person (except identical twins).
- Matches suspect to crime scene blood/hair.

slides.title: Pandemics
slides.content:
# Going Global üò∑

When an epidemic spreads worldwide.
- **Zoonosis**: Disease jumping from animal to human (Spillover).
- Monitoring and global cooperation are key defenses.

slides.title: Microbiology Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Microbes usually help us (Food, Digestion).
- **Germ Theory** saved billions of lives.
- **Biotechnology** harnesses cellular machinery for medicine and industry.
- The small things run the world.
